conclusion: Understand the graph shows the relationship between x/t (position over time) and t (time).
The graph is a straight line with a positive slope, passing through the point (0, 10).
The line can be represented by the equation x/t = mt + c where m is the slope and c is the y-intercept.
The slope m is calculated as m = (10 - 0) / (0 - (-2)) = 5.
The equation of the line is x/t = 5t + 10.
The term 5t represents the linear increase in position over time, implying constant acceleration.
The term 10 represents the initial velocity since it is independent of time.
The slope of the line in an x-t graph represents the acceleration, so acceleration a is equal to the slope m, which is 5 m/sÂ².
